sentences: Oliver Daniel (November 24, 1911 â€“ December 30, 1990) was an American arts administrator, musicologist, and composer.
Also in 1954 he helped found the CRI (Composers Recordings, Inc.) record label, along with composers Otto Luening and Douglas Moore.
For many years, Daniel worked with and promoted composers such as Henry Cowell, Lou Harrison, Alan Hovhaness, Colin McPhee, and Peggy Glanville-Hicks.
He also wrote an exhaustive (and somewhat hagiographic) biography of the conductor Leopold Stokowski titled Leopold Stokowski: A Counterpoint of View (1982).
For much of his life Daniel lived in Scarsdale, New York, with his partner Donald Ott.
